website_summaries.verdict: With 1 cubic foot of storage, this safe will hold a lot of personal papers and other items securely.
pros: Offers a keypad entry or with a key backup
Can be bolted down from inside the safe
Compact enough to fit in many spaces including inside drawers or closets
Same safe comes in slightly smaller sizes
cons: This safe is not rated fireproof or waterproof

customer_reviews.title: GREAT safe for money. See review and pics.
customer_reviews.text: Great little safe! Not fireproof but for what I needed it for it's perfect. Update. I lost my house this past week to a fire. It was a total loss. Somehow this safe made it with 4 handguns in it as well as ammo and various paperwork. It still managed to open USING KEYPAD when the firefighters brought it out!!!! I can't recommend this safe enough now.
customer_reviews.author: JV

customer_reviews.title: Add a safe light
customer_reviews.text: A very good basic safe. I have no complaints. For my needs I probably could have used the slightly smaller version. One tip, I put a motion sensing battery operated LED closet light in the safe. The small round light came with magnets that stick to the inside top of the safe. Open the door and the light comes on..... This makes it very easy to see and find documents in the safe. Shut the door and the light goes out!
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Absolute garbage. I watched the review-video about opening the safe-box ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage. I watched the review-video about opening the safe-box with pen. I thought it was a joke. I tried and it worked. I can't believe these idio..s make a safe which u can open with a pen and sell to people.
customer_reviews.author: Gulistan

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY. EASILY DEFEATED!!!
customer_reviews.text: The safe can be defeated by a simple BIC pen in under five seconds. I sincerely hope no one is keeping firearms or other dangerous items in the safe I thinking they are safe from children. And adolescent could easily pick this lock.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Bilnoski

customer_reviews.title: Batteries can die; keep the keys handy; angle grinder will serve in a pinch
customer_reviews.text: This safe was alright until the batteries died without notice, making it impossible to enter with the combination. Having lost the keys, I attempted to pick the #495 tubular lock, but could not do so despite a few hours' work and about a dozen different gauges of pen (despite claims in other reviews here -- perhaps they're better lockpickers, or are actually demonstrating a different safe). I eventually used an angle grinder to force entry through the back. Entry was of course destructive to the safe, though the contents were not harmed. Entry required less than ten minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Black

customer_reviews.title: Defective electronic security lock
customer_reviews.text: Had to return it. The electronic security mechanism was defective. After resetting with your personal code (yes, I included the "#" key), it works 1x but then you get locked out after that. I think it's resetting to factory presets because after it stops accepting my personal code, I try the preset code referenced in the manual and voila! It works. Doesn't like my personal code. But it likes factory. ('Don't think it's supposed to work that way though.)
customer_reviews.author: Mel Aclaro

customer_reviews.title: Safe withstands night with angry theives armed with hammers and crowbars.
customer_reviews.text: Bought one for our soccer concession stand and bolted it to the wall. Just last night a robbery attempt was made and ... although the safe was badly beaten with hammers and crowbars, our cash was safe and the thieves got nothing for their work! And with the key we were still able to open it even though the face-plate and electronics were completely destroyed. Buying another one now to replace it :-)
customer_reviews.author: M. Blachly

customer_reviews.title: Failed safe.
customer_reviews.text: Every few months the code won’t open the safe. I have to use the key and press the reset button on the inside. Not very good.
customer_reviews.author: G.

customer_reviews.title: Easily accessible.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this safe unless you're strictly concerned about protecting your contents from fire or other elements. If you keep anything in there that you don't want people getting a hold of ie a gun, prescription meds, etc. this is the wrong safe to buy. My teenage son showed me last night how easy it is to get into it by inserting a broken ballpoint pen in the key tumbler. He had it open in less than 2 minutes. Ridiculous Amazon would put out a product like this.
customer_reviews.author: Drew A. Paff

customer_reviews.title: Very nice safe, right size for a bedroom closet
customer_reviews.text: Very nice safe, right size for a bedroom closet, DOWNSIDE!!! purchased on 4-15-17, on or about 11-15-17 it no longer worked, Oh its the batteries, replaced them, Oh bad set of batteries, also replaced still does not work. Messed with the special key, still does not work, will not lock regardless of activity to the safe controls. Guess I need a new one.
customer_reviews.author: ming1

customer_reviews.title: Bounce this safe from the comfort of your home!
customer_reviews.text: I learned this fun trick when my safe ran out of batteries, and immediately purchased something else. Fun trick , I encourage anyone that owns it to give it a whirl. While the safe is closed/locked, try the following. 1) Turn latch to the right--it won't open because it's 'locked' 2) While you are doing this, take your other hand, make a fist and slam the top just above the locking mechanism 3) Repeat this a few times (while your hand is turning the lock to the right) 4) VOILA! Safe is open
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: we found nothing to complain about despite other reviews
customer_reviews.text: I’ve read a lot of reviews to narrow down this type of safe. I saw claims that a pen could open the safe however, I could not open mine with a pen. My husband and I both also read a review where A person included photographs of the safe that caught on fire. While it claims it is not fireproof we were impressed how well it managed through a fire. We like the space this provides inside, and the purpose for why we have a safe in our home. We had no trouble with it opening, we had no trouble with the keypad, and the keys work as well. For the price the safe is more than satisfactory .
customer_reviews.author: 🍀🍀 GREEN IRISH EYES 🍀🍀

customer_reviews.title: Speed bump but certainly a good all around safe for overnight use
customer_reviews.text: Having done considerable research, virtually all 'hotel style' safes seem to be vulnerable to entry, some with a paper clip. Consider this one to be a speed bump, certainly not impenetrable but an obstacle to someone (child, someone in your home lifting objects from your dresser....) who doesn't have the time, skill, or tools to open it AND also purchase a $1,000 +/- fireproof and tamper resistant safe (for costly items) with a conventional combination lock and secure it to the floor or wall.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality, perfect size for me. Bought this to keep a few of my pistols locked up, and some various papers I didn't want to lose. This fits in my closet perfectly and does exactly what I want. I haven't bolted it to the floor yet, but it's pretty straight forward if I choose to do so. Keys work well, as does the digital combination pad. Great value for the price... no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Seymour

customer_reviews.title: I like it but....
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this safe to store items in for four days now. It was easy to mount and easy to program. Today, the code stopped working. I knew I wasn't typing it in wrong but continued to get the red key lock on the display. I waited 5 or so minutes and tried again and it still wouldn't open. I'll just use the key. I read a lot of reviews from buyers who use this to lock their handguns up. I would caution anyone who intends on using it for that purpose to NOT rely on the code to work for you to open safe in case of an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: TicTacToe

customer_reviews.title: Low Price, Low Protection Capabilities, and I Am VERY Happy
customer_reviews.text: I have had it only a week and it is everything that I expected. I don't expect it to withstand a severe fire or a thief with a pry bar. I use it to store my hand guns, passports, and a few other documents that may be difficult to replace. I am using eneloop rechargeable batteries in it so the cost of batteries is a minor concern. HOWEVER, because of the negative reviews I chose to add an extra year's warranty in case the electronics fail.I have NEVER bought an extended warranty before. If you need greater protection be prepared to pay for it.
customer_reviews.author: TCJ2

customer_reviews.title: I ordered this safe to replace a combination safe I ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this safe to replace a combination safe I already have. After I received the safe I proceeded to try to open it. You are suppose to take a cheap plastic cover off where you insert the key. The only way to remove the cover was to stick a sharp knife into the crack and try to open it. After the cover was off I inserted one of the two keys. I turn the key and the safe wouldn't open. I tried numerous times with both keys. The safe was returned for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Mendota

customer_reviews.title: Just over a year old and something has gone wrong ...
customer_reviews.text: Just over a year old and something has gone wrong with the lock. It shows a red ! with a red circle around it. That indicates the wrong code is being entered. I access this safe a few times a week and DID NOT forget the code. Can't find the keys.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: dementia grandma breaks in
customer_reviews.text: Great safe if you're not trying to keep anything safe. The overall look of this safe is nice however we put my great grandma's medications in here to keep them away from her as she will tend to hide them and forget about them We thought locking them up would be a great way for her to stop playing with them however she managed to bust open this safe with a butter knife only! If she can figure out how to bust open this safe surely many other people can! Not worth the money spent
customer_reviews.author: Jae

customer_reviews.title: Boxes of ammo
customer_reviews.text: I like this safe, though I'm going to trade up for a bigger one. One question I had when researching, that I couldn't find an answer for in the reviews / Q&A, was how many boxes of ammo would the safe hold, if that's ALL you put in there. For the 0.7 cf safe, using boxes of 50 rounds of 9mm ammo, you can fit 4 high x 2 deep x 5 wide = 40 boxes of ammo (or 2000 rounds). The safe would be pretty full at that point -- not jammed tight but you couldn't fit much else. May be able to squeeze a small handgun in there.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C.

customer_reviews.title: Economy Level and Affordable
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this is a good safe at a good price-point. Just know that you get what you get. I chose this and I'm not disappointed. It does what I need it to do. The only reason I knocked a star off is....well, three small reasons. There is a small dent/blemish on top right out of the box. The felt liner was put in backwards, but easy to correct. Lastly, once you pop the key cover, which you need to do to set the eLock, it isn't as clean looking (small gap, not as tight). But, that's it! It functions, has good heft, looks good, and deters folks from getting into your goods.
customer_reviews.author: Liquid Frost

customer_reviews.title: ugh
customer_reviews.text: Wow, looks nice but now the electric part stopped working!!! Put new batteries in and nothing. SO now I can only unlock with key and its just so much more hassle
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for. Good for fire protection, buy a more expensive one for theft prevention.
customer_reviews.text: I don't recommend buying this if you're planning on putting some serious valuables in it. I bought it as a gun safe for my handguns since I have a toddler in the house. I also put any documents I wouldn't want to lose in a fire. The keyhole is covered by a plastic cover that could be easily broken. If someone knew what they were doing they could probably break into this pretty easily. Edit: Changed from 5 to 4 stars because I had forgotten that my safe did not come with the cover for the batteries..Soo, that doesn't look great that I see the batteries every time I open the door.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied! Great affordable safe
customer_reviews.text: This is a great safe I absolutely Love it! I Love the fact that you can use a key to open it if the batteries die in the electronic lock. It is pretty well made and sturdy for the price. I have had no trouble with it opening and would absolutely recommend this safe if you are looking for something small and affordable this safe will do the job. I am very satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: TimTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Awesome purchase
customer_reviews.text: We’re extremely happy with this purchase. For the $ amount it is great. We ordered the bigger one and it holds two pistols and lots of ammo and still plenty of room for other things. It was easy to setup. Of course it doesn’t have all the gits and gadgets of other safety lock boxes. But it does what it needs to do. We didn’t need an anti theft or one with extra security measures. Just something safe to have our guns in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Conveniently placed on a shelf near where my wife takes off her jewlery.
customer_reviews.text: My wife's jewelry was disappearing. Not that it's all that valuable but it was annoying her to lose some favorite pieces. Couldn't tell if it was the cleaners or the guests my son would have over when we were traveling. We have two other safes but it was too much trouble for my wife to walk to the other side of the room and open the other safe. Now she has her own safe on a shelf in her closet. When she takes her earrings off...etc. she opens the safe and no more missing jewelry. Oh...get the key option ...my wife periodically forgets the code that she won't share with me. Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: Richard F. Bader

customer_reviews.title: Say what?!
customer_reviews.text: I reviewed a lot of safes before deciding to purchase this 1.0 Cu ft. model. One thing that was never mentioned, and which I think is critical, is this: Three consecutive unsuccessful attempts to open the safe will cause it to unlock automatically...!!! What?! More than three attempts will cause it to shut down for 5 minutes, which should be more than enough to discourage a burglary. But it seems pretty easy for anyone to open it, if they know the routine. I'm downgrading my ratings for this very reason, but am keeping the safe, hoping that thieves won't be reading Amazon reviews before setting out to do what they do.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Not secure at all!
customer_reviews.text: Wow how terrible can a safe be! I have this in my room to hide stuff from other family members. I noticed some stuff missing and then they showed me how it can easily be knocked open without unlocking by giving it a hard thud! It just swings right open. Worst safe ever
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: Works. Doesn't work. Works. Doesn't work. Rinse. Repeat. Rinse. Repeat...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work. The keypad takes the set code and allows for the safe to be opened properly only once. Every subsequent attempt results in an error. Code must then be reset and allows for the safe to be opened once. Rinse and repeat. Doesn't that sound super fun?! SURPRISE! It's not...
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Ault

customer_reviews.title: 👍👍
customer_reviews.text: Bargain! Great product. Great price. I was on the fence about this safe because of the reviews I've read and how it can potentially be open with just a bic pen. So I gave it a shot. At worst, I would just return it if I could get it open with a bic pen. Well... it stood it's ground against the almighty bic pen, I could NOT gain entry. I will be buying 3 more, one for each of my kids to keep their private belongings, and money, safe. People, it's a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Marco

customer_reviews.title: The electronic lock stopped working right after 30 days!
customer_reviews.text: This is a product I see every day at home so I had to write a review despite it being purchased 3 years ago. So basically I needed a simple safe to keep documents like the family passports. It was great in the beginning but around 5 days after the 30 day return period the electronic lock stopped working completely. Now I can only lock/unlock with the keys provided and have to make sure I don't lose them! As for the safe itself, it has 2 levels and is good enough to put documents, credit cards and small jewelry boxes, nothing too tall.
customer_reviews.author: Chela

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: This safe has proven to be a stress reliever. I know where my stuff is now and I don’t have to find where I hid it. I purchased an auto on and off light and a fireproof bag for my docs. This safe is perfect fit on my shelf and after set up it takes seconds to get in and out of it. The entering the code first time takes a bit but if you follow the directions it should set up without a hitch. You also have to remember to turn the knob after you close the door otherwise it won’t be locked.
customer_reviews.author: Retired

customer_reviews.title: Replace Please
customer_reviews.text: I recieved this package yesterday, and I was so excited. Problem is the top for the key hole is made of cheap material and was easily broken. Now I understand, you fuller get what you pay for. But this is ridiculous. If Im planning on keeping this safe for a LONG time, why does it have to br broken. I am completely happy with the safe itself, and I dont want to replace it. Im wondering if I could get a replacement top for the key hole? Ill be happy to update my star review if somone could get in contact with me. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Not meant for jewelry or valuables
customer_reviews.text: My daughter locked my keys in it and I hadn't set up the keypad and there were no batteries installed. It had been over a year that I owned it. I bought it mainly to have fireproof for my important documents. Called customer service they said they would issue me a replacement and to destroy this one. It was sadly easy to break into with just a couple hits with a hammer on the face. Probably wouldn't buy this to store expensive valuables. I appreciated the customer service. Didn't expect that on such an old order.
customer_reviews.author: Juliet_5

customer_reviews.title: Latch broken - safe will not open
customer_reviews.text: We only had this safe about 6 months before the latch broke, and we are unable to open the safe. We have the code and it works, but the safe will not open.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Nice strong safe!
customer_reviews.text: The safe is nice, has lots of space if there is one complaint the included wall anchors are for concrete. I don’t know who has concrete walls. So you’ll need to pick up different wall anchors are a local supply store or order them. I got these and they worked well Drywall Anchor kit - Hollow Wall Anchors with Screws ,self-Drilling Hollow Wall Anchor, for Drywall,Nylon - Plastic - Buildex,100 pcs (Combination 2)
customer_reviews.author: Helder F. Jacinto

customer_reviews.title: Disable beep
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat it for the price. To disable the beeping: - remove the batteries - remove two screws holding the cover on the back of the door - pinch the sides of both the anchors holding the board and remove the board (refer to pic) - while holding the button, carefully heat the solder of the two connections and gently pull the button until it's off (refer to pic) - reassemble the board/cover Note: in case I wanted to put it back on, I taped the freed button to the inside of the cover with electrical tape. Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition to our home - redundant lock/access is a PLUS
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Had several models in my "list" and finally chose this one. The big PLUS is it comes with a set of override keys. It may not seem like a big deal now but at 3AM and you're fumbling with the keypad...oh yeah..those keys will be a lifesaver. We secured it with the supplied expansion bolts and stored the keys in separate location. Am planning to purchase another for small handgun separate storage. Cons: None so far.
customer_reviews.author: detconnection

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my elderly mom who lives in a large senior complex. She is always worried the maid or someone is stealing from her. She likes this because it has a keypad so she doesn't have to worry about a key laying around. Her memory isn't that great but she does remember the code. It also comes with 2 keys which are being held by my brother and the security chief at her complex. It's a nice size, and the shelf allows even more room. The security chief where she lives liked it so much he is going to recommend it to other residents.
customer_reviews.author: Chicgal

customer_reviews.title: Defective locking device.  Under warranty but all customer service numbers are shut down.
customer_reviews.text: The safe is probably a good product but ours is only 5 months old, rarely gets used and the emergency unlocking key just spins in the lock. It is under warranty but Amazon has shut down all of their customer service numbers and is not responding to our warranty calls. What do we do?
customer_reviews.author: Steven&Kathy Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Just bought another one
customer_reviews.text: I got this yesterday, and like it so much I just purchased another one. I bought this to secure our medicine. It actually fits in the cabinet for us. So far it is working great and meets all my expectations. Only time will tell if I will continue to be happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Sweet Challenge

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money with this safe a bic pen can open it without the key or the code
customer_reviews.text: This safe is a good idea but needs to be improvements with the key. I have bought two of them and they got broken into. I’m looking for a real safe that can’t be broken into like the ones with the round key because anyone can use a BIC pen and open the safe without the key that it came with or the code!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I didn't feel like packing it all up and sending it back so ...
customer_reviews.text: I have the same problem as other reviewers. Went I tried to remove the plastic cover that is over the key lock it broke. I didn't feel like packing it all up and sending it back so I put some double face tape on the back of the cover and put it in place. Other than that is seems like a good deal for the money. Easy to bolt down, locking mechanism seems fine so I guess time will tell. I think I might try to contact Amazon and get a new plastic cover. I would think that whomever reads the reviews from Amazon would address this issue.Let's see what happens.
customer_reviews.author: IraGNYC

customer_reviews.title: The Size printed is incorrect the depth with the door closed is 7.38 inches.
customer_reviews.text: The Size printed is incorrect; the depth with the door closed is 7.38 inches. Amazon feels that people care about what can fit in the safe when the door is open apparently. This cannot fit letter sized documents as the specs would imply.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin Lipschitz

customer_reviews.title: Simple and safe!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little safe. I always bought those 3 hour sentry fire safes and they ALWAYS BREAK! I end up having to crowbar them open because the mechanism on them. Anyhow, I bought one of these for my business and no trouble yet... been over a year, this is my second one, which I bought for my home. I read a review about it where it actually survived a fire, so figured I would buy it and I give it a try. I am not disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Camila Perry

customer_reviews.title: Not a really a 'security safe' and chances are it won't work when you get it
customer_reviews.text: This electronic lock box probably would have served my purposes just fine, but unfortunately it arrived with an electronic lock that didn't work. Returned for refund and will buy something else. That said... this is less of a 'security safe' than a 'lock box' anyway and could be easily compromised.
customer_reviews.author: Denard D. Springle IV

customer_reviews.title: Can be improved...
customer_reviews.text: so i have been on the hunt for a safe to store important items that i want to keep safely and away. I would say for a budget safe this will do the job. The cost is relatively inexpensive compared to the competition. I really like it from the aspect of price and usages however I am really disappointed that it lacked step by step instructions on how to set it up. Also the instructions for the bolts are extremely poor and I had to look up instructions on the web... I would recommend they revamp the instructions and maybe put some video links.
customer_reviews.author: Mikee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent home safe at a great price!!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for a small indoor safe to hide valuables, medications, and quite a few handguns. Easy to bolt down anywhere (floor or wall) & discreetly hide from thieves. Highly recommend bolting your safe down because it is light & small enough for someone to carry out of your home if someone wanted to. Easy to setup & operate. Definitely great quality for the money!! Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: KellBell

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive safe
customer_reviews.text: I bought this safe to keep our passports and a few handguns in , in which it has more than ample room for. For a comparison it could probably hold at LEAST as much as a boot/large shoe box. Directions are easy and simple for the digital lock, or you can use the keys that come with it. Is everything its advertised to be. 4 stars due to the fact the first one I got was severely damaged, the lock/door wouldn't open and 2 corners were clearly dented/damaged. Damage was also done BEFORE the safe was put into the cardboard/Styrofoam shipping box as it had no damage on it meaning it was damaged and then placed into its shipping box.
customer_reviews.author: Rick T

customer_reviews.title: Great For It's Intended Purpose
customer_reviews.text: The lock is cheap and easily defeated (two stars). The door could probably be pried open (three stars). The water resistance is nonexistent (one star). So if you're looking for a quality, waterproof/fireproof, tamper-proof safe this isn't it. BUT, that's not what I bought it for. I just needed to keep my handguns from being accessed by a three-year old. And for that purpose this is a great, affordable solution (four stars). It's very roomy and will hold a lot more than two or three handguns if you so desire. One big drawback is the loud beeping it makes when the keys are pressed. If that could be turned off it would get another overall star.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyPTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: When a very valuable gold necklace went missing I was concerned our cleaning service had taken off with it. After I bought this very functional safe my wife found where she had misplaced it. Over the years she had lost and found several pieces. Now, since the lock has a simple 4 number coder and is easily opened and closed, she always puts her jewelry in the safe. By the way losing and misplacing things is also why we now have a burglar alarm! We kept that too! Peace of mind.....
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Nice Safe Terrible Installation Hardware
customer_reviews.text: The safe itself seems well built and easy to use.....the installation is a disaster...no instructions and very poor design...I have using installations hardware for 50+ years and this is the worst...the opposite of intuitive and doesn’t “grip” in thinner walls .... To the buyer: throw out the original hardware and buy Toggler Heavy Duty1/4 inch Toggle Bolts ( Product # 50400). If you’ve already drilled the 12mm holes and are going out of your mind, the Toggler uses same sized hole....With the Toggler,the entire installation process took 4.5 minutes ....and you will avoid a stress level that could lead to drugs and promiscuity.... To Amazon: PLEASE speak to your vendor about this issue...
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Robert T. Nible

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: It does the job but you get what you pay for... it’s made in China so it’s mostly plastic outside - buy something made in the USA if you want better quality. We will see how the digital panel holds up over time. The plastic cover over the key access broke when opening it for the first time as you have to pry it open to get in the first time to install the batteries and set the code. We’ll see how the customer service is for this vendor and see if they will send me another one (it’s probably a 10 cent piece of plastic). I’ll circle back and upgrade/downgrade this rating based on their response to that issue.
customer_reviews.author: Woodlands Dog Guy

customer_reviews.title: It will keep the honest people honest...
customer_reviews.text: Installation hardware is totaled trash unless you mounting it into concrete (must have the EXACT size drill, even if installing it into concrete) So you will need to buy hardware to correctly install it into any other material. The holes in the bottom of the safe are smaller than the bolts they give you for concrete installation. Yes, you read that correctly. You will have to drill out the holes in the bottom of the safe to use the hardware kit provided. The top and sides of this safe can easily be broken into with a cut-off-wheel or circular saw. Only get the safe if you are handy and if you’re only trying to protect things from being tampered with.
customer_reviews.author: TheCottonTop

customer_reviews.title: Plastic Feature
customer_reviews.text: I've had the safe for about a month now, and haven't had any issues with its operation. However, the triangular key-hole cover is made of cheap plastic and the instructions (which aren't very clear) tell you to "pry" it off without any direction on how you should successfully pry a piece of plastic. Not surprisingly the piece broke and now I have a piece of scotch tape holding it on. Doesn't appear to be very secure when its being held together by scotch tape. It's a decent price for a small safe, but I was very disappointed in the cheap plastic key-hole cover.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use and affordable
customer_reviews.text: Purchase over 6 months ago now. The price was affordable and as usual deliver was quick with amazon. The construction is decent for the price. Quality is not the best, has a little wiggle on the door when closed. When done closing the door it’s hard to tell when it’s done locking, but has had no issues mechanically. Does the job at home to keep important things safe from kids or people trying to get in while it’s still in the home. I do think it would not hold up if it was removed and taken out of the home and forced open with tools.
customer_reviews.author: jose rosales

customer_reviews.title: It has been said that these are easily broken into my picking the lock
customer_reviews.text: It's not fire or water proof, heck it's not even burglar proof. It has been said that these are easily broken into my picking the lock. I wouldn't know about that as I have my combination and a set of back up keys. I didn't purchase it to keep large amounts of cash or jewelry in, I purchased it more to secure items when grandchildren are around. It is anchored tightly to a shelf and anchored as well to the wall behind it. The overall size is great and does come with a removable shelf and a carpet do lay down for protecting stored items. I look to purchase a second soon for use in another part of the house.
customer_reviews.author: JVJ

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: I already have two safe deposit boxes at two banks; I didn't need another place to store the really important stuff. I wanted a place to store a pistol or two, some extra cash, etc. I live on the Texas Gulf Coast where there are hurricanes; fire isn't my concern, but simply destruction of my home as a possibility (though not flooding). This little safe is perfect for what I wanted. I probably would've bought a larger size looking back on it (it comes in 4 sizes) but at this great price may just buy a second one!
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Much  more substantial than I expected at that price.
customer_reviews.text: Suitable for important documents. It's solidly built and works as expected. It's not going to stop a professional jewel thief but I don't think they are coming to my place. No, you can't open it with a pen although, from the photos some people have posted, it looks like the type of lock has been changed. For the price, and for our needs, you can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Bob S.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good lil safe. I used some high quality lithium batteries, opens, and locks how it should. Totally happy with it. Not the best of the best either, but for the money its great. You can buy fire & water proof zipper bags to store any valuables to may want to protect a bit more as the safe id not fire or water proof.
customer_reviews.author: Ftg

customer_reviews.title: Great value for price
customer_reviews.text: The key entry and the code entry both work well. The safe is a good size and not too heavy. I can fit several handguns, clips, and boxes of ammo inside, and still have space left over for stacks of money -- if I only had any stacks of money! Not much of a complaint, and certainly not enough to lower my rating, but it's worth noting that the mounting holes for securing it to your wall are a bit large, and the included anchors are too big to be practical in an apartment with a security deposit. I chose to use drywall screws with washers.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Useless.
customer_reviews.text: An absolute piece of crap safe. The key got stuck in the lock on first use and will not come out. Lock mechanism feels very flimsy. And even worse... the manual says that if you put in the code incorrectly 3 times in a row, it auto-locks for 30 seconds... and then AUTOMATICALLY UNLOCKS. What a joke. Not secure at all.
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: Received locked with no keys. Useless garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a small safe for son to protect his valuables from sibling. received the box locked an unable to open. No keys or paperwork. I assume they are inside the locked box. Sent back for replacement. Got a replacement today and this one actually had the instruction booklet and keys on the outside, so we were able to open the safe and install batteries and add a lock code. That was the good part. It will not open when using the code. Must use key. Total garbage. This one is going back too. I'd give this zero stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Ti_gers

customer_reviews.title: What good is gun safe you must always open with a ...
customer_reviews.text: I have followed instructions, input a password, got the beep and unlocked symbol, but the silver dial will not turn clockwise to open the safe. What good is gun safe you must always open with a key?
customer_reviews.author: Marvin J. Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Is this a joke?
customer_reviews.text: This safe is not a safe in my opinion. You can really open it with a BIC pen as some have pointed out. The design is simple and looks like many safes found in hotel rooms. The keypad works on mine with four AA batteries. But seriously, if you use this make sure you either place items of not much value or a decoy to your real safe somewhere. I find many Amazon Basics items deliver a good value but not this one.
customer_reviews.author: Max™

customer_reviews.title: Not 2 Secure
customer_reviews.text: I liked the size and the durability of the shell. However, by chance I discovered that the knob that opens the door can be chiseled out (not that I did) exposing a hole that would permit your to use your finger to manually open (avoid the locking mechanism) the door. This is a major flaw and prevents true security of the Cabinet Safe. For general security (not for protection from true thieves) it provides a deterrent protection from thief of a relatively honest person.
customer_reviews.author: G'Wood

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Pretty happy with this purchase. Set up was easy for the lock, and comes with bolts to secure it to the house (that can only be removed from the inside). This is definitely a value buy and it doesn't really come with any other bells and whistles. It is not fire/waterproof, but it isn't supposed to be. My only little critique is the lock knob itself had a very cheap feel to it. I don't question the security of the safe, but I do wish the know had a higher quality to it.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Overall just OK. It's cheap and if it meets your use-case you'll like it.
customer_reviews.text: I really want to like this safe, and at the price point I guess I do. The speaker is way too loud, but is easily (and permanently) disabled with a knife. There are plenty of YT videos showing how to defeat the lock w/o the key or the code, but for now I'm not too concerned. I'll probably replace this at some point with something better. Kind of wish I had shopped around more.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Good safe for the price
customer_reviews.text: This safe is certainly not going to keep out someone who knows what they are doing, but for what I needed it for it’s perfect. But if you decide to store very important things in the safe id recommend to bolt it down because it would not be hard at all to carry it off and open it later. (bolts are provided with the safe... bonus!) luckily if you decide to bolt it down it does seem sturdy enough to where you can not use a pry bar and get inside or smash into it with a hammer. For what it’s worth it is a great safe and I’d buy it again if I needed to.
customer_reviews.author: Ninja4liferyan

customer_reviews.title: OK for an inexpensive safe
customer_reviews.text: It's a good value for the money. The safe works well, but I wouldn't use it for valuables. Thieves would have little difficulty prying open the door to the safe. I don't consider that a design problem, because it's well made for the money spent to purchase it. I use it to prevent my grandchildren for accessing items that could do them harm. But they are not professional thieves, so there is no worry that they will be able to open this safe. Just understand what you are buying this safe for.
customer_reviews.author: LWD

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Of course, everyone wants the best safe money can buy, but the reality is if we bought the best safe we wouldn't have anything left to lock up. This safe is roomy, and when mounted correctly, a very effective unit. I used lag bolts to secure the safe into the wall studs instead of using the provided anchors. The provided anchors are good if mounting into concrete. As I installed it, it would probably take someone an hour or more to get it out of the wall. Likely that is more time than a burgler wants to be in someone's house making a lot of noise.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied and YOU CANT UNLOCK THIS SAFE WITH A PEN
customer_reviews.text: People have been saying you unlock this safe with a pen; That is impossible with the safe they sent me(which was probably an updated version) that has a different key head not allowing you to open the safe with any sort of object other than the key, not unless you can lockpick you could probably unlock this safe. I am very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: ERIC

customer_reviews.title: Received a broken safe, if you can believe that.
customer_reviews.text: When I got this safe, I was unable to open it because the door had come loose and the opening frame around the door of the safe was slightly blocking the door from opening. I couldn't tell if the tumblers were working completely, likely not since the door was off its hinge at least partially. I returned it, which, to their credit, Amazon got right on top of. But, honestly, I can't have an experience like that with a safe and be expected to buy another one of the same kind. It's a safe. It is absolutely not supposed to give you that kind of trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Compton

customer_reviews.title: Batteries lasted......one week.
customer_reviews.text: The batteries which allow you to lock and unlock lasted one week. As I write, the safe is closed and I am in another town 75 miles distant. I have the override keys and no time to drive them there. So.....my employees cannot get to their needed items. Very annoying. Who knows how long the new replacement batteries will last?
customer_reviews.author: S. Langston

customer_reviews.title: Weak and easy to break into
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. Ran out of batteries and I couldn't find the manual key, so I had to break into it. Took 1 hit with a sledge hammer to knock the door in.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Stopped registering my code!
customer_reviews.text: The darn thing stopped registering my code! I had to reset it 3 times already. If you get this, don't lose your key because you may need it. At first I thought it was the batteries so I changed them and the key pad still forgot the code. It does the job of keeping it secure from others but i'm not sure I would trust it if you are needing to quickly open it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Barrera

customer_reviews.title: Its a great size for keeping his passport and other documents and ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son for collage. Its a great size for keeping his passport and other documents and his jar of quarters... His roommate ended up using it too. Nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Donna H.

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my little safe
customer_reviews.text: I'm super happy with this safe. I bought it when I hired a cleaning service, because I didn't want to worry about some of my nice jewelry and important documents. I'm worry free with this in action, and I tucked it away where nobody sees it without taking some serious time to snoop. I love that I can set my own code, and it has worked perfectly for me ever since. I'm happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Jagroo

customer_reviews.title: This safe is a great alternative to the other more expensive units
customer_reviews.text: This safe is a great alternative to the other more expensive units. It feels very durable ans unlocks/locks very easily via the electronic keypad. It comes with a set of keys so that you are never locked out in case the battery dies. This safe can be bolted in place if desired. I feel that this safe will last many years and the storage space is more than adequate. I should also mention that the storage space features a felt lining and a shelf which divides the storage space in half. So far, I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen J. Beauvais

customer_reviews.title: Works fine when it works but you re taking your chances at it staying locked
customer_reviews.text: After a few months the safe stopped locking. I changed batteries, reset the combination and still it would not lock. I finally used the key while fiddling with the knob and buttons and it started to lock again. I'm not sure how long this will stay. A safe that won't lock reliably is not real useful. In general, I have noticed that amazon basic items are pretty much becoming the junk end of the category they are in. Too bad since they started out being OK to nice. I guess I will have to go back to buying known good items from other manufacturers and leave the basics for people who don't really want something that works.
customer_reviews.author: E. Pope

customer_reviews.title: does the trick
customer_reviews.text: I use it for my medication to keep out of the hands of everyone. I've had problems in the past with missing them after guests or home workers have been in my home. I KNOW! RIGHT? I've always kept them out of sight but since I've had this safe I can relax. I did research many home safes and this was the one that was priced right and had great reviews. I've only had it about a month. But, it's easy to set up, it's durable and I love the several ways only I can open it. I'm not sure how long the batteries will last as I open it 2x's per day. It is worth the peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: sammy1

customer_reviews.title: LOCKED OUT
customer_reviews.text: Granted it’s partially my fault for locking the keys inside - but the batteries in this safe died not even two years afternoon purchase and now we can’t get into it. Mainly writing this review based on my numerous phone calls with amazon who is the manufacturer of this and who offered zero help in resolving this problem. Don’t want a refund or a new product. I want what’s inside my safe. (Also can’t get into it with a BIC pen like all other reviews are saying?)
customer_reviews.author: Jenan Matari

customer_reviews.title: Works but cheap
customer_reviews.text: Locks and it's very light. The metal is super thin. Flexes if you press on it even just lifting the unit because the door and lock is heavy but the rest is paper thin. To top that off there Are pre drilled holes in the bottom and the back, completely negating any fire or flood resistance there maybe
customer_reviews.author: Joshua C.

customer_reviews.title: Great casual security
customer_reviews.text: This is a basic “hotel room” style safe, good for keeping things secure from grab and run thieves and children. It allows relatively quick access, and seems reliable. We have installed one of these in our last four homes (we seem to be flipping houses lately), and have never has an issue. Best if bolted down, second best might be liquid nails on a surface not amenable to bolts, such as a garage slab. Not for water or fireproof applications - that will cost a bit more...
customer_reviews.author: Will VONDAUSTER

customer_reviews.title: Great production
customer_reviews.text: I really like these safes for storing my small handguns. They keep them out of reach of children and others. Some people give them really bad reviews but come on what did you really expect for this price point? They are just for keeping out the unwanted and for safety. They are not made for or priced for stopping aall out burglary. If you want that then pony up the big bucks and buy a real safe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Security Safe for Price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice security safe. You have the option to mount it to the wall, not too heavy either. The lock and code feature is helpful. When it arrived, the bottom of the door would get hung up and not close properly though, so we returned it. I opted to go ahead and spend the extra chuck of money and buy a water and fireproof safe instead. It is what I personally was really wanting. They did refund us our money and covered shipping since the Safe was not working properly, just FYI. That’s why I gave them 4 stars! However, if you are just looking for a security safe only, this is a good one for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Pucel

customer_reviews.title: Good Safe, Uses Lots of Batteries
customer_reviews.text: I like the digital combination. It takes a LOT of double A batteries, so I'm hoping that means I wont have to replace them anytime soon. The only thing I dont like is the knob you turn to open it. It feels poorly put together from cheap plastic and I'm worried it will break at some point. So far it's worked fine it just feels weak.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This safe has a programmable code, so you can pick your own - love that. Also the override key is there for if you forget the code or the battery dies (I like the suggestion mentioned to use lithium batteries for long life). There are also mounting points so that a thief doesn't just take the safe with them. Maybe it's not the place to keep the Pink Panther, but this serves my needs completely, and at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Walker

customer_reviews.title: High quality safe!
customer_reviews.text: This was a little bigger and heavier than we expected, but it's great! So easy to open/close/lock. Just read the instructions (which are very well written). This is very similar to the type you find in nice hotels. In fact it might even be a little larger. But it will definitely fit your laptop, ipad, phone, even some documents. It has a handy shelf included which you can choose to use or not. A worthwhile purchase.
customer_reviews.author: HummingbirdsTop Contributor: Running

customer_reviews.title: Good safe but it's not all that SAFE
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty thin metal so don't buy this thinking it's going to keep someone out if they "Really" want in it or that it'll protect your gun from a fire because it won't. My use case is a small desk safe in my downstairs office. I work from home a good bit and transfer my gun from off my person to the desk I have small kids so I wanted something to lock it up. It's a good safe for that purpose. It'll keep kids out but it wouldn't stop a sledge hammer or cutter. Thin metal.
customer_reviews.author: D. Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Expansion bolts are cheap junk; requires a hammer drill and masonry drill bit to install in concrete floor...
customer_reviews.text: The safe is well constructed, instructions are clear, and the price is very reasonable. On the other hand, the expansion bolts provided with the safe are cheap junk. I had to replace them with higher quality 1/2" concrete expansion bolts from Home Depot. A half inch masonry drill bit and a hammer drill are required for mounting to concrete, which what I did. Doubles the costs and aggravation. Otherwise, mounting to studs means that anyone with a Sawzall could rip the safe out of the wall or floor joists in a few minutes. Still, am satisfied with the purchase...
customer_reviews.author: OnceUponATime

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for papers and small items.
customer_reviews.text: This safe was absolutely perfect for my needs - personal papers and some valuable jewelry. It has a shelf so things are not all piled on one another. We bolted to the floor with no problem. You can either use a key to unlock it (it comes with two) or a digital code (requires 2 AA batteries). The price was unbelievable and while I did have to wait while it was on backorder, the wait was worth it. If you prefer not to bolt it, it's not that heavy that you couldn't carry it to your car in an emergency situation.
customer_reviews.author: pamela4949

customer_reviews.title: Not fire proof, but for the price, its not too bad of a safe.
customer_reviews.text: I was undecided on this based on other reviews. I always look at the poor rating first. I purchased this safe for size and cost. It was easy to program the code, and the safe opens and closes properly. I didn't like the flimsy shelf and the felt mat on the bottom. Otherwise, Its OK, I screwed it down to a cabinet and all is well. With the display, I thought it would show the numbers you pressed, but it only shows lock or unlock. I'll be curious to see how long the batteries last since Amazon offers a lot of batteries at an addition price. For now, I am using Duracell batteries from Costco
customer_reviews.author: F. Masters

customer_reviews.title: Does fine for what it is
customer_reviews.text: For what it is, it’s fine. It won’t keep a determined person from getting in, but it’s enough to deter a curious kid away from your stuff. The door doesn’t close solidly, rattling around even when locked. The inside space is good for the price and it can be bolted down or to the wall. If you need a safe, this isn’t one, but if you just need a locked place that can’t be snatched whole, this will do.
customer_reviews.author: bugout

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: The one I received was damaged so I had to return it. Amazon fulfilled it's requirements in this respect and my rating does not reflect this part of my experience. I was not impressed with the functionality and build quality of this safe. I know it's a low cost, low end offering and I was not expecting anything more than what was in the product description. However, at this price point there are way better options available from other brands.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dueck

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: This safe is just wonderful. The perfect size to keep jewelry and small items safe. I do not even plan on bolting it in (bolts are included) . I just wanted to have a place to keep valuables out of sight when I have workers or a cleaning service in. It fits perfectly on a standard bookshelf, unlike larger counterparts. The keypad layout is a little odd. The zero is not where you would expect, but you get used to it. I may buy a couple more. P.S., For those interested, it is also the perfect size for storing a handgun, a few accessories, and a few boxes of ammunition.
customer_reviews.author: BJ Safdie

customer_reviews.title: Is it the best safe on the market
customer_reviews.text: This is a no frills safe that I use for storing my pew pew. Comes with two keys and the ability to set your own code. Is it the best safe on the market? Probably not but considering the price it does the trick. You can bolt it down to make it a bit harder to grab and go. But if you are looking for something discreet that can be hidden easily. This will do the trick. I wish the shelf inside was covered in felt, but that isn't a deal breaker really.
customer_reviews.author: Stewart M. Cockrell

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT OPEN WITH BIC PEN! Good safe for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good safe for the money. Comes complete with steel anchors if you decide to do so and is actually made of plate steel. Hinge hardware looks stout and robust as well. I’ve seen the reviews of Bic pens being used as keys of you take the ends of the pen and try to slide the tube of the pen into the lock. I’m happy to report that the design has definitely been updated. I’ve tried with several different pens and was not able to slide the pen tube into the lock. I purchased the 1 cubic foot safe.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: I was not very impressed with this safe. I purchased it to replace an older safe of the same size that quit working after 10+ years. This safe seems to be cheaply made, with very thin walls. The locking and handle/dial mechanism also seems very cheap. I realize this safe is not fireproof rated, but neither was my previous safe, and this new safe is about half the weight as the previous one. I don't feel very "safe" that what I put inside is "safe".
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Worldwide

customer_reviews.title: Missing small cover to key 🔑 hole.
customer_reviews.text: Literally just opened. Noticed a piece that covers the key hole is missing. (Did not find inside the shipping box) Also there is a sticker with a red arrow pointing to a scratch. I don’t mind that there’s a scratch. I do mind that it was noted but it wasn’t fixed before it shipped to the next buyer. I was expecting it to be much heavier. Convenient size. Wish I had the cover to the key 🔑 hole.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

product_meta.title: AmazonBasics Steel, Security Safe Lock Box, Black - 1 Cubic Feet
product_meta.description: Size:1 Cubic Feet| Style:Standalone SafeAn Amazon Brand.
feature_bullets: 1-cubic-feet security safe with electronic lock and 2 emergency override keys
Steel construction with carpeted floor to protect against scratches and damage; Safe is not fireproof or waterproof
2 live-door bolts and pry-resistant concealed hinges; adjustable/removable interior shelf
Reprogrammable digital access; uses four AA batteries (not included)
Four bolts included to mount safe to wall, floor, or shelf
Product Dimensions: Exterior measures 16.93 x 14.57 x 9.06 inches (LxWxH); Interior measures 16.81 x 12.15 x 8.94 inches (LxWxH); door thickness is approximately 2 inches

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars11,456 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
